defs.docs: Create new Server builder instance

defs.name: workers
defs.docs: Set number of workers to start.

attributes.value: / Set number of workers to start.
/ The default worker count is the number of physical CPU cores available. If your benchmark
/ testing indicates that simultaneous multi-threading is beneficial to your app, you can use
/ the [`num_cpus`] crate to acquire the _logical_ core count instead.

defs.name: worker_max_blocking_threads
defs.docs: Set max number of threads for each worker's blocking task thread pool.

attributes.value: / Set max number of threads for each worker's blocking task thread pool.
/ One thread pool is set up **per worker**; not shared across workers.
/     .worker_max_blocking_threads(4); // every worker has 4 max blocking threads.

defs.name: backlog
defs.docs: Set the maximum number of pending connections.

attributes.value: / Set the maximum number of pending connections.
/ This refers to the number of clients that can be waiting to be served. Exceeding this number
/ results in the client getting an error when attempting to connect. It should only affect
/ Generally set in the 64-2048 range. Default value is 2048.
/ This method should be called before `bind()` method call.

defs.name: max_concurrent_connections
defs.docs: Sets the maximum per-worker number of concurrent connections.

attributes.value: / Sets the maximum per-worker number of concurrent connections.
/ All socket listeners will stop accepting connections when this limit is reached for
/ By default max connections is set to a 25k per worker.

defs.name: system_exit
defs.docs: Stop Actix `System` after server shutdown.

defs.name: disable_signals
defs.docs: Disable OS signal handling.

defs.name: shutdown_timeout
defs.docs: Timeout for graceful workers shutdown in seconds.

attributes.value: / Timeout for graceful workers shutdown in seconds.
/ After receiving a stop signal, workers have this much time to finish serving requests.
/ Workers still alive after the timeout are force dropped.
/ By default shutdown timeout sets to 30 seconds.

defs.name: Server
defs.docs: General purpose TCP server that runs services receiving Tokio `TcpStream`s.

attributes.value: / General purpose TCP server that runs services receiving Tokio `TcpStream`s.
/ Handles creating worker threads, restarting faulted workers, connection accepting, and
/ Creates a worker per CPU core (or the number specified in [`ServerBuilder::workers`]) and
/ distributes connections with a round-robin strategy.
/ The [Server] must be awaited or polled in order to start running. It will resolve when the
/ On UNIX systems, `SIGQUIT` will start a graceful shutdown and `SIGTERM` or `SIGINT` will start a
/ forced shutdown. On Windows, a Ctrl-C signal will start a forced shutdown.
/ A graceful shutdown will wait for all workers to stop first.
/ The following is a TCP echo server. Test using `telnet 127.0.0.1 8080`.
/                             // end of stream; bail from loop
must_use = "Server does nothing unless you `.await` or poll it"
